{{convert|6|in|mm|adj=on|sigfig=4}} Mk XII guns]] *1 x [[6 pounder gun|6-pdr A/A]] *1 x [[QF 3 inch 20 cwt|3-inch (76 mm) AA gun]] for ''M31'' and ''M33'' </table> |Ship armour=<table> * 1–3 in magazine box protection * 2.25 in belt * 1 in deck, turrets and bulkheads </table> |Ship armor= |Ship aircraft= |Ship aircraft facilities= |Ship notes= }} |} The '''''M29'' class''' comprised five [[monitor (ship)|monitor]]s of the [[Royal Navy]], all built and launched during 1915. The ships of this class were ordered in March, 1915, as part of the [[Emergency War Programme]] of ship construction. The contract for construction was granted to [[Harland and Wolff|Harland & Wolff]], [[Belfast]], who sub-contracted the construction of the ''M29'' and ''M31'' to Workman Clark Limited. The main armament of the ships, 2 [[BL 6 inch Mk XII naval gun|6-inch Mk XII guns]], came from guns originally intended for the five {{sclass|Queen Elizabeth|battleship}}s which became surplus when their aft casemate mountings turned out to be unworkable and were dispensed with. == Ships of the class == *''[[HMS M29|M29]]'' - launched on May 22, 1915 and later renamed ''Medusa'' and ''Talbot'', she was sold in 1946. *''[[HMS M30|M30]]'' - launched on June 23, 1915 and sunk on May 14, 1916. *''[[HMS M31|M31]]'' - launched on June 24, 1915 and broken up for scrap in 1948. *''[[HMS M32|M32]]'' - launched on May 22, 1915 and sold in January, 1920. *[[HMS M33|''M33'']] - launched on May 22, 1915, is one of a number of World War I-era warships in existence today and is located in dry-dock near [[HMS Victory|HMS ''Victory'']] at [[HMNB Portsmouth|Portsmouth Naval Base]]. ==See also== {{Commonscat-inline}} ==References== *{{Colledge}} *[[Jane's Fighting Ships|Jane's Fighting Ships of World War One]] (1919), Jane's Publishing Company {{M29 class monitor}} {{WWIBritishShips}} {{DISPLAYTITLE:''M29'' class monitor}} [[Category:M29-class monitors| ]] [[Category:Monitor classes]]
